definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: He is a very experienced general and has made great contributions in battles.
sentences.chinese: 他是名久經沙場的大將軍，戰功赫赫。

sentences.english: He makes himself Shogun, or "commander-in-chief for suppressing barbarians".
sentences.chinese: 他自封幕府將軍“徵夷大將軍”。

sentences.english: He is the third general of the Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他是當朝第三的大將軍。

sentences.english: So Emperor Wudi made up his  mind, and appointed Du Yu the Grand General for Conquering the south .
sentences.chinese: 於是司馬炎就下了決心，任命杜預作徵南大將軍。

sentences.english: ShouCheng napoleon tang wall to follow after.
sentences.chinese: 守城大將軍唐壁隨後跟至。

sentences.english: He suffered castration because he irritated the Emperor by defending a general.
sentences.chinese: 由於爲一位大將軍辯護，惹怒了皇帝，被處了官刑。

sentences.english: Kim Jong Il has also promoted his younger sister Kim Kyong Hui to the rank of general.
sentences.chinese: 金正日同時將他的妹妹金敬姬也任命爲大將軍銜。

definition: Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
to go on a punitive expedition
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
